definition: to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: Annabel and Julia ran to the microphone where the announcements were being held.
sentences.chinese: 安娜貝利和茱莉亞立刻跑向了廣播室。

sentences.english: The radio studio manager at WXBN looked down at me.
sentences.chinese: 在這個WXBN廣播室，經理向下看我。

sentences.english: How can I apply for CFA Institute membership?
sentences.chinese: 我能借用一下你們學院的廣播室嗎？

sentences.english: Each school has a broadcasting room.
sentences.chinese: 每個學校都有一個廣播室。

sentences.english: At the age of nine, I asked for jobs in small radio stations.
sentences.chinese: 當我九歲時，我就在一個小廣播室要了一份工作。

sentences.english: Let's go to the broadcasting room upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 我們一起去樓上的廣播室。
